author: bridgebuilders
title: Catalyst Leadership Academy
description: Catalyst requires world-class leadership skills to level up our impact, and growing these leaders from inside the community is critical.

f6_assessments.q0: This is a nice proposal by people heavily involved in the Catalyst community to create an open source set of resources and provide weekly and bi-weekly courses over a period of three months. The proposed budget is relatively modest at $18,290. At this cost if delivered it could provide a great resource that many proposers can access.
f6_assessments.q1:
The team proposing this are well established in the community. Their combined entity, Bridgebuilders is new and thus untested, but the individuals have good experience in the space. It is not clear they have experience delivering this type of course. One of their KPI's is to recruit at least two experienced business executives from outside the ecosystem but it is not clear they have allowed any budget for this?
The budget otherwise is quite modest. Is $15k to build and deliver a leadership and a strategic planning course enough to build a good course?
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a clear delivery timeline and creation of repo's of documentations against which progress can be audited. The KPI's noted don't seem to make the measurement of success clear. How are Relevance (applicability),Delivery (instructor) and Value (relevance) measured? What measurement would be considered a success? Course ranking by participants is obviously easy to measure, but what rank would be considered a success, 4+ out of 5? What metrics will you be asking for feedback from participants on?

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal directly answers the challenge brief by incrasing the professional readiness of funded projects and their leaders. It is very much needed and will help create a lot of value into Project Catalyst and to the wider Cardano ecosystem.
f6_assessments.q1: Although initially the proposal only includes two instructors it does state that the plan is to bring along many other qualified trainers. Knowing the people behind this initiative it is clear that it will be a success.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics, objectives and key results are very clearly outlined and it will be easy to track the progress of the initiative.

f6_assessments.q0: The aim of the proposal is to impart leadership skills to Community members to be able to deliver effectively and have positive  impact on their communities. The Catalyst Leadership Academy wants to create an open source educational  materials, presentations and seminars for those looking to improve and expand their leadership skills. Having read through the proposal, the challenge is effectively addressed.
f6_assessments.q1: Collaborative group of the Bridge Builders and the Catalyst School have the requisite skills to deliver. The plan outlined will have an active recruitment campaign to get more qualified instructors from the community to hold courses and seminars based on the community needs. They will get on board other industry experts to assist to make implementation successful.
f6_assessments.q2: They mentioned that they will share all information with the community which will be open for auditing. The budget is broken down into details and the road map is clear from February 2022 to April 2022. for effective auditing.

f6_assessments.q0: * The idea of the proposal matches the challenge setting very well. Empowering and leading teams in the last 15 years I learned a lot, sometimes the hard way. Leadership is mandatory in order to be successful as a team. The problem statement is very clear, the intended solution, too. From previous after town hall sessions I know that there is a high demand. As all is going top be available open source and at no cost it will help not just in this fund but in the future, too. Given the package and the scalability I consider this as a no-brainer proposal.
f6_assessments.q1: * The proposer know what they are talking about in order to use the right resources required to implement the proposal. The team shows evidence that it is capable of delivering the solution as intended. The timeline is clear with measurable packages in a monthly base. The budget breakdown is very clear and includes even an hourly rate. The requested budget is reasonable and fair for what they ask for. What could be improved is the part how to win the audience in other to participate in the leadership school. What I love personally is the effectiveness of the tools they are intending to build top, like the book club or the leverage of wisdom fro established ones like the Theory U.
f6_assessments.q2:
The OKRs make it easy to see the impact for Catalyst members.
Problem, solution, roadmap, budget, team is all clear understandable and having it on YouTube and GitHub it is simple to audit.

f6_assessments.q0: Having courses, seminars, materials, and templates in open-source and available to the community at no cost is an awesome idea. This will definitely help build good leaderships within the Cardano Community. As the challenge brief states "Knowledge is power and enabling project's to tap into to a distributed network of professional mentors and supporters will enable ventures to grow stronger and faster." I think Catalyst leadership Academy will add to this and the impact on the Cardano Catalyst ecosystem will be very positive.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer names the team members and their experience and skills, LinkedIn links are also provided. They seem competent enough to push the project forward. More experienced lecturers/instructors in certain fields will be appointed to present the courses, they will come from within the community and Bridge Builders. The budget is broken down and makes sense and are reasonable to achieve goals. There is a road map and KPI;s that shows how they want to move forward and in what time frame, and milestones they want to reach. Risks are not discussed or how they will be dealt with.
f6_assessments.q2: Course materials and offerings will be made open-source and shared with the community and shared on YouTube and Github. They will follow up each offering with a student survey on the effectiveness of the material, suitability for Catalyst projects and collect feedback, all these are a means for the voters and community members to track the progress of the project and makes it auditable.

solution: The Catalyst Leadership Academy is where community members can teach and learn leadership skills. Offer high-quality and relevant courses.
experience: Bridge Builders have decades of collective experience managing teams, running companies, and successfully launching projects and communities
